description: {"blocks":[{"key":"i4au","text":"This protocol enables the isolation of nuclei from frozen tissues. These nuclei are suitable for use in ATAC-seq, single-cell ATAC-seq, ChIP-seq, HiC/3C, and many other assays.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a93if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5cuk","text":"Modified for a small amount of fruit fly brains from the omni-ATACseq protocol from Ryan Cortes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Isolation of nuclei from frozen tissue for ATAC-seq and other epigenomic assays

groups.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3r26k","text":"The quality of the tissue at the time of freezing is a major factor in the quality of data downstream. If freezing tissue for use later, you may want to consider cryopreserving 50 mg tissue chunks in BAM Banker cryopreservative. If using previously frozen tissue, the ischemic time or post mortem interval should be kept as short as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"blep2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"avbv5","text":"Nuclei can be cryopreserved in BAM Banker. In our experience, freeze-thaw cycles do not adversely affect data quality as long as thawing is carried out on ice and freezing is performed using a slow-freeze freezing container. We have had success isolating nuclei from every tissue we have tried including difficult to work with tissues such as heart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ATAC-seq, Nuclei Isolation, Frozen Tissue Homogenization
manuscript_citation: Corces MR, Trevino AE, Hamilton EG, Greenside PG, Sinnott-Armstrong NA, Vesuna S, Satpathy AT, Rubin AJ, Montine KS, Wu B, Kathiria A, Cho SW, Mumbach MR, Carter AC, Kasowski M, Orloff LA, Risca VI, Kundaje A, Khavari PA, Montine TJ, Greenleaf WJ†, Chang HY†. An improved ATAC-seq protocol reduces background and enables interrogation of frozen tissues. 2017. Nature Methods. (PMID: 28846090).

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nv22","text":"Pre-chill all tubes. For each sample you are processing, you will need: (i) one 2 ml cryo tube with 10 1.6 mm beads for bead homogenization (ii)  one 1.5 ml round-bottom LoBind tube for nuclei pelleting (iii) one 1.5 ml round-bottom LoBind tube for collecting purified DNA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81gub","text":"Prepare all buffers. For faster dissolution, crush protease inhibitor tablets prior to addition to 1x Homogenization Buffer Unstable Solution. DTT, Spermidine, Spermine, and digitonin are stored at -20°C. All other detergents, ATAC-RSB, and other buffers are stored at  . Do not prepare transposition mix ahead of time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":269,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3sqdt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"04BE2170C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajina","text":"Place tubes in thermal cycler, making sure lid is tightly against your tubes, and run program ML2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbar6","text":"Add 10 uL of cleaned tagmentation product. Mix and spin down. Make sure to close PCR tube lids tightly with a marker end.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6b88","text":"Add 2 uL of primer mix to each reaction. Make sure to record which index primers are used!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u9c4","text":"Visually inspect primer plate to ensure evaporation has not occurred in the wells you intend to use. Spin down in plate spinner. Carefully open foil to needed wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: (Optional) Cleanup and Freezing Down of Extra Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eqibr","text":"If you would like to save extra nuclei for other assays or to potentially use in additional ATAC-seq experiments downstream:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jldq","text":"After incubation, follow instructions of Qiage Minelute DNA clean-up Kit to purify the DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n8cb","text":"Incubate reactions at   for   in a heat block (ideally should use a thermoshaker with 1000 RPM constant shaking).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e4vus","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60e4a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C9558B00C85611E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"CC6981C0C85611E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":0,"label":"","preset":[]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kkp","text":"Unlike the published ATAC-seq protocols, you do not need to do an individual lysis step in this protocol because the nuclei are exposed to NP40 throughout the Douncing portion of the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73m4k","text":"Add 50 ul ATAC-seq Reaction Mix to each tube and pipette up and down 6 times to resuspend nuclei pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n69n","text":"Using a p1000 pipette, remove all but the last 100 ul of supernatant. Remove last 100 ul with p200 pipette set to 200 ul using a single fluid pipetting motion. Place the tip of your pipette on the opposite side of the tube to where the nuclei pellet is located during this final aspiration step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
